title: 112_hr2694
content: The Act titled "Medicare Firewall Act of 2011" references the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PPACA) and aims to defund certain provisions of the PPACA to restore funding to Medicare trust funds. The Medicare Firewall Act of 2011 aims to defund certain provisions of the PPACA, including defunding new duties for consensus-based entities and multi-stakeholder group input, and defunding the Independence at Home Demonstration Program. The Independence at Home Demonstration Program under the Social Security Act is being defunded by amending subsection (h) of section 1866E. Funds transferred under this section will be restored to the Medicare Trust Fund. The Community-Based Care Transitions Program and Demonstration Project on Separate Payments are being defunded by amending certain sections of the PPACA. Funds transferred under these programs will be returned to the Medicare Trust Fund. The defunding of the Demonstration Project on Separate Payments for Complex Diagnostic Laboratory Tests includes terminating the project and transferring unobligated balances back to the Medicare Trust Fund. Additionally, the Outreach and Assistance for Low-Income Programs are also being defunded. The Medicare Improvements for Patients and Providers Act of 2008 is amended to extend availability of funds until 2011. Unobligated balances will be transferred back to the Medicare Trust Fund. The Independent Payment Advisory Board (IPAB) is defunded under Section 3403. Defunding of the Independent Payment Advisory Board (IPAB) under Section 3403 of the Social Security Act and defunding of Prevention and Wellness Evaluation under Section 4202(b) of the PPACA. Amendments are made to various sections to remove funding provisions. The Medicare Firewall Act of 2011 rescinds unobligated balances and defunds a pilot program for individuals residing in emergency declaration areas. Transfers made before the enactment date must be returned to the Medicare Trust Fund. The unobligated balance must be transferred back into the Medicare Trust Fund from which it was originally transferred before the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. ACCOUNTABILITY FOR TRUST FUND DEMONSTRATION PROJECT EXPENDITURES. The Secretary of Health and Human Services must report to Congress within a year of this Act's enactment on covered demonstration projects that have not met objectives or resulted in net expenditures from the Medicare Trust Funds. For identified projects, a plan for termination or modification must be included. A covered demonstration project refers to a project funded by any of the Medicare Trust Funds.
